location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 35: Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, refers to William Newnham's letter of 24 December 1823, which concerned the maintenance of a public table at the Residency during the Resident's absence. Stannus reports that, during his recent tour of the Arabian coast, Assistant Surgeon James Pringle Riach kept a public table at Bushire and charged the expenses thereof to the Government of Bombay. Stannus concludes by submitting on Riach's behalf an application for an extra allowance for carrying out these duties.
